page.title: 02Leicester News 7 JUNE 1985
page.content: On a motorway in Leicestershire a thirty-one year old man died.The incident happened as the man got out of his car and was run over by a passing lorry. {A seventeen year old boy was found {dead yesterday by his brother in an {outhouse on Leicester Road, Hinckley. {The police say there are no suspicious {circumstances. Most of Leicester's low ground may well be flooded because of the heavy rain recently.The R.S.P.C.A. has warned farmers to move livestock to higher ground. {On June 20 most of Leicester's shops {will be open until 9pm.This is due to {a road race in the city.There will be {free parking in most car parks. } The weather.Today will be quite cold, it will rain in the East Midlands. Maximum temperature 11 degrees.
